001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.function.Predicate;
005
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
010import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
011
012/**
013 * Utility class for defining custom model operations that can be used in the
014 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater} to create custom update stages
015 * for outbreaks and people.
016 *
017 */
018public class ModelOperation {
019
020        /**
021         * BiFunction is not used in the current implementation but is provided for
022         * potential future use cases where a two-parameter function might be needed.
023         * It follows the same pattern as TriFunction, ensuring it is serializable
024         * and can be used in similar contexts.
025         *
026         * @param <A> the type of the first argument
027         * @param <B> the type of the second argument
028         * @param <R> the type of the return value
029         *
030         */
031        @FunctionalInterface
032        public static interface BiFunction<A, B, R> extends Serializable {
033                /**
034                 * Applies this function to the given arguments.
035                 *
036                 * @param a the first function argument
037                 * @param b the second function argument
038                 * @return the function result
039                 */
040                R apply(A a, B b);
041        }
042
043        /**
044         * An Update stage processor for outbreaks.
045         *
046         * @see ModelOperation#updateOutbreakState(Predicate, TriConsumer)
047         */
048        public static class OutbreakStateUpdater
049                        extends UpdateStage<ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, Outbreak> {
050                OutbreakStateUpdater(
051                                Predicate<Outbreak> selector,
052                                TriConsumer<ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, Outbreak, Sampler> consumer
053                ) {
054                        super(selector, consumer);
055                }
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * An Update stage processor for people.
060         *
061         * @see ModelOperation#updatePersonState(Predicate, TriConsumer)
062         */
063        public static class PersonStateUpdater
064                        extends UpdateStage<ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person> {
065                PersonStateUpdater(
066                                Predicate<Person> selector,
067                                TriConsumer<ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler> consumer
068                ) {
069                        super(selector, consumer);
070                }
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * Functional interfaces for the selector and consumer functions used in
075         * update stages. These are defined here to avoid dependencies on external
076         * libraries and to ensure they are serializable for use in distributed
077         * contexts.
078         *
079         * @param <A> the type of the first argument
080         * @param <B> the type of the second argument
081         * @param <C> the type of the third argument
082         */
083        @FunctionalInterface
084        public static interface TriConsumer<A, B, C> extends Serializable {
085                /**
086                 * Performs this operation on the given arguments.
087                 *
088                 * @param a the first input argument
089                 * @param b the second input argument
090                 * @param c the third input argument
091                 */
092                void accept(A a, B b, C c);
093        }
094
095        // Generic updaters these are used in the updater
096        // and see ModelUpdate for where this infrastructure is used.
097
098        /**
099         * TriFunction is defined for potential future use cases where a
100         * three-parameter function might be needed. It follows the same pattern as
101         * TriConsumer, ensuring it is serializable and can be used in similar
102         * contexts where a return value is required.
103         *
104         * @param <A> the type of the first argument
105         * @param <B> the type of the second argument
106         * @param <C> the type of the third argument
107         * @param <R> the type of the return value
108         */
109        @FunctionalInterface
110        public static interface TriFunction<A, B, C, R> extends Serializable {
111                /**
112                 * Applies this function to the given arguments.
113                 *
114                 * @param a the first function argument
115                 * @param b the second function argument
116                 * @param c the third function argument
117                 * @return the function result
118                 */
119                R apply(A a, B b, C c);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * An abstract update stage comprises of a selector which allows you to
124         * filter the input, using getSelector, then process the input using
125         * getConsumer..
126         *
127         * @param <FACTORY> the builder for the next
128         * @param <INPUT>   the type of object to update.
129         */
130        public static class UpdateStage<FACTORY, INPUT> {
131                Predicate<INPUT> selector;
132                TriConsumer<FACTORY, INPUT, Sampler> consumer;
133
134                private UpdateStage(
135                                Predicate<INPUT> selector,
136                                TriConsumer<FACTORY, INPUT, Sampler> consumer
137                ) {
138                        this.selector = selector;
139                        this.consumer = consumer;
140                }
141
142                /**
143                 * Getters for the selector and consumer functions. These allow the update
144                 * stages to be used in the Updater without exposing the internal
145                 * implementation details.
146                 *
147                 * @return the consumer function for this update stage
148                 */
149                public TriConsumer<FACTORY, INPUT, Sampler> getConsumer() {
150                        return this.consumer;
151                }
152
153                /**
154                 * Getters for the selector and consumer functions. These allow the update
155                 * stages to be used in the Updater without exposing the internal
156                 * implementation details.
157                 *
158                 * @return the selector function for this update stage
159                 */
160                public Predicate<INPUT> getSelector() { return this.selector; }
161        }
162
163        /**
164         * Creates a custom updating function that runs against an outbreak when the
165         * selector is matched. The updating function can change anything about the
166         * future state of the outbreak.
167         *
168         * @param selector selects whether to run this updater for a given Outbreak
169         * @param consumer a three parameter function taking the builder, current
170         *                 outbreak, and a RNG.
171         * @return An updater suitable for
172         *         {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#withOutbreakProcessors(OutbreakStateUpdater...)}
173         */
174        public static OutbreakStateUpdater updateOutbreakState(
175                        Predicate<Outbreak> selector,
176                        TriConsumer<ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, Outbreak, Sampler> consumer
177        ) {
178                return new OutbreakStateUpdater(selector, consumer);
179        }
180
181        /**
182         * Creates a custom updating function that runs against an person when the
183         * selector is matched. The updating function can change anything about the
184         * future state of the person.
185         *
186         * @param selector selects whether to run this updater for a given Person
187         * @param consumer a three parameter function taking the builder, current
188         *                 outbreak, and a RNG.
189         * @return An updater suitable for
190         *         {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#withPersonProcessors(PersonStateUpdater...)}
191         */
192        public static PersonStateUpdater updatePersonState(
193                        Predicate<Person> selector,
194                        TriConsumer<ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler> consumer
195        ) {
196                return new PersonStateUpdater(selector, consumer);
197        }
198
199}
